text:
Hi,

I have this plotting function

```function plotBranchCont(contres::ContResult, sol::BorderedArray, contparms, plotuserfunction)
	if length(contres) ==0; return ;end
	fig = Figure(resolution = (1200, 700))
	ax1 = fig[1, 1] = Axis(fig, xlabel = String(getLensParam(contres.lens)), ylabel = String(getfirstusertype(contres)), tellheight = true)
	lines!(ax1, contres, color = :blue)

	ax2 = fig[1, 2] = Axis(fig, xlabel = "step", ylabel = String(getfirstusertype(contres)))
	lines!(ax2, contres.step, contres.param, color = :blue)

	if isnothing(plotuserfunction) == false
		# ax3 = fig[2, 1:2] = Axis(fig); plotuserfunction(ax3, sol.u, sol.p)
		ax3, line3 = plotuserfunction(fig[2, 1:2], sol.u, sol.p)
	end
	
	fig
end```
which I call like `BK.plotBranchCont(br, u1,1, (ax, x, p) -> contour(ax, sol0))`  but the last grid is tiny. How can I make it larger?

elements.text:
Hi,

I have this plotting function

function plotBranchCont(contres::ContResult, sol::BorderedArray, contparms, plotuserfunction)
	if length(contres) ==0; return ;end
	fig = Figure(resolution = (1200, 700))
	ax1 = fig[1, 1] = Axis(fig, xlabel = String(getLensParam(contres.lens)), ylabel = String(getfirstusertype(contres)), tellheight = true)
	lines!(ax1, contres, color = :blue)

	ax2 = fig[1, 2] = Axis(fig, xlabel = "step", ylabel = String(getfirstusertype(contres)))
	lines!(ax2, contres.step, contres.param, color = :blue)

	if isnothing(plotuserfunction) == false
		# ax3 = fig[2, 1:2] = Axis(fig); plotuserfunction(ax3, sol.u, sol.p)
		ax3, line3 = plotuserfunction(fig[2, 1:2], sol.u, sol.p)
	end
	
	fig
end
BK.plotBranchCont(br, u1,1, (ax, x, p) -> contour(ax, sol0))
but the last grid is tiny. How can I make it larger?

text:
Probably julius will answer if you put it on discourse, but I think a simple thing would be to just make the last row bigger. Like, `fig[2:3, 1:2]` or something.

There might be a better way with `tellheight` or `tellwidth` attributes or something, not sure.
